summary: If you could pick any one change, big or small, made in the TV series and ask D&D 'Why didn't you just do this the way it...
question: If you could pick any one change, big or small, made in the TV series and ask D&D 'Why didn't you just do this the way it happened in the books?' what would it be?

summary: i think jonsa will happen but i really don't want it to now even though i do ship it. reassessing sansa & jon's storylines and...
question: i think jonsa will happen but i really don't want it to now even though i do ship it. reassessing sansa & jon's storylines and the overall story i think it's not going to be a positive thing for sansa. it reduces her to a secondary character in his story (kidnap plot!). i want sansa to be happy but not at the cost of her agency and development. all this considered d&d will do this as they don't care for sansa & would repeat the prisoner/hostage once again to benefit other characters. it's sad.
answer: if jon’s character is written like robb’s was where he’s important but not to so important that all the main characters become secondary characters, i wouldn’t mind that much (i’m used to white male characters winning) but if our speculations are right then jon gets everything. i doubt there’s going to be room for anybody else. there’s a high chance that the final teaser was right and all the main characters will only exist to prop up jon in one way or the other and that is so damn depressing to me. i’m invested in my favourite characters and i want them to finish their arcs and accomplish something that would have been their season 1 versions proud. the last thing i want is them acting as shields or serving jon especially if it’s their own storyline.

summary: When Jon and Sansa fight it’s “sparks flying” and “they’re flirting!” and “love is in the air.”  But when Jon and Daenerys are...
body:
When Jon and Sansa fight it’s “sparks flying” and “they’re flirting!” and “love is in the air.”

But when Jon and Daenerys are stiff and at odds with each other in their first meeting it’s “ominous” and “doesn’t bode well” and “not romantic.”

Ironic isn’t it?

summary: Sleepy - TimeTurner - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
title: Sleepy - TimeTurner - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Underage
Relationships: Petyr Baelish/Sansa Stark
Characters: Petyr Baelish, Sansa Stark
Additional Tags: Canon Universe, this is… wrong, i’m trash, not precisely dub-con, there is a not-so subtle hint of daddy kink
Summary:

After a very long day having to deal with the Lords Declarant, Petyr wants nothing but to get to the peace and quiet of his solar, where he can finally be alone. However, when he gets there, he notices his solitude will have to be postponed. Lying deeply asleep on his bed, is no other than his dear daughter.

summary: So Jonsas are threatening to bully sansan fans out of the tags and calling us pedos. What's your take?
question: So Jonsas are threatening to bully sansan fans out of the tags and calling us pedos. What's your take?
answer:
My take is that this is all so boring - this wouldn’t be the first time people tried it with the sansan ship. Our inbox has been filled with hate from the same six people, sent anonymously but still identified by an extension we have on our site.

We’re all about the positive and not interested in playing along or calling them out. Bullying doesn’t work - it never has, but I will say that if they do, they will be reported to both Tumblr and law enforcement since cyberbullying is a crime in the US. We’ve stopped it in the past using these methods and won’t hesitate to do it again.

If people are genuinely wondering about the ship, there is plenty of meta here:

@kateofthecanals Defending SanSan series which pretty much covers anything a non-shipper might want to know.

As for Sandor Clegane, he is not a pedophile - this accusation is just a way of justifying their hate. He never touches her in a sexual manner, nor does he groom her to accept advances. 

GRRM specifically wrote his character as drunk and PTSD triggered when he said or did inappropriate things to Sansa (commented on her growth spurt, held a knife to her throat) and even then, immediately reminded himself that she was a child and backed off. There is nothing in canon that suggests it ever went any further. And no one hates his behavior more than Sandor, since it is on his mind as he lay dying.

There is no evidence that he treats the Lannister children he is constantly around in a sexual or perverse way either, and that’s not how pedophilia works.

It is specifically mentioned, however, that Sandor goes to brothels, so we know he prefers grown women.

GRRM writes a lot of screwed up relationships that actually do venture into pedophilia, incest, sexual abuse, torture, etc. so I have no idea why they are fixated on sansan.

As I see it, GRRM is the person that antis really have a problem with over the sansan ship - he wrote the series and the relationship specifically to be seen as beauty and the beast trope. He admits he deliberately played with it in the books.  He commissioned sansan art for his home and his publications. 

People can hate any ship they want but that isn’t the same as threatening other shippers. Whether or not they dislike a ship isn’t even the point: there is no moral high ground for people who bully, harass and verbally abuse real, breathing human beings over fictional characters and ships. 

Antis are abusers and they try to engage others because it gives them the supposedly justifiable excuse they “need” to bully and harass other people.

If people believe that their approval of someone’s entertainment choices is the deciding factor in whether or not they treat them like decent human beings, then they need to rethink their behavior and make changes and stop worrying about other people.  - Mod Feather

summary: This is a promise Ned makes to Sansa way back in Season 1. At the time, however Sansa is not receptive of this. She is enamoured...
body:
This is a promise Ned makes to Sansa way back in Season 1. At the time, however Sansa is not receptive of this. She is enamoured by Joffrey and wants to be his queen and have the the kind of life she’s heard about in songs.

This image is brutally shattered once Ned is executed and she is repeatedly emotionally and physically abused by Joffrey. Even after everything she goes through she still manages to come out stronger and alot more self aware.

Now, considering everything she suffered at the hands of Joffrey it makes sense for her to want someone who is completely the opposite of him and:

It also helps that he perfectly fits the criteria for Ned’s promise-

Brave:

Gentle:

Strong:

Also how considering marriage has been a very important aspect of Sansa’s character arc, it makes sense for her to finally have a happy marriage like the one her parents had.

This would also enable both of them to stay in Winterfell, their home. Fortunately the parentage reveal actually facilitates a romantic relationship for them.

They already have an emotional foundation for a romantic relationship and Jon’s reaction to every potential romantic rival it makes it makes it that much more obvious to me.

Also, Sansa hasn’t had a protector since Ned died or anyone she could truly rely on and Jon’s continued insistence on protecting her makes their marriage more likely. This is because a part of the wedding ceremony is the cloaking of the bride with the words “You may now cloak the bride and bring her under your protection.“

All of this just convinces me that we are gearing towards a Jonsa endgame.

Also, Sansa hasn’t had a protector since Ned died or anyone she could truly rely on and Jon’s continued insistence on protecting her makes their marriage more likely. This is because a part of the wedding ceremony is the cloaking of the bride with the words “You may now cloak the bride and bring her under your protection.“

All of this just convinces me that we are gearing towards a Jonsa endgame.

otp: i the wolf she my moon
summary: the rules of the game - castling | Archive of Our Own
title: the rules of the game - castling | Archive of Our Own
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
In the group there are five of these wild children, each is cautious and their eyes are watchful as they take in their surroundings. The tallest of them steps forth, her hands clasped together with something between them.

“Your Graces. We once roamed this country freely and without care. We have no been pushed to the outskirts of these lands, beyond the wall is all we can call home. Your First Men came and they slaughtered us,” Her eyes scan the guards that now have stepped back, swords sheathed. “We chose to defend ourselves by making the White Walkers and we will be forever indebted to you, Daenerys of House Targaryen, for ending the nightmare we made. As payment for this debt, we offer you a gift.”

Read now on AO3

summary: GOT S8 Teaser: What can we observe in this teaser? Jon, walking past Lyanna’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of a Stark pledge to...
body:
GOT S8 Teaser: What can we observe in this teaser?

Jon, walking past Lyanna’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of a Stark pledge to PROTECT Jon from ambitious, ruthless monarchs.   

Sansa, walking past her mother’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of Catelyn’s grief over her (show invention) inability to LOVE Jon, suggesting Sansa will correct her mother’s regret.  

Jon, walking past the statue of the man who raised him. Voiceover reminds us that Jon is a STARK.  

Three Starks gather in front of their own statues, reminded of their own mortality. A threat grows, extinguishing the fire Jon was clinging to.  Three Starks turn to face the threat.  

We know a fight is coming.  The freezing air that approaches is coming for them.  But it’s is coming for them not on the battlefield, or on the ramparts.  It’s coming for them in the crypts.  The place where thousands of years of Starks are buried. Make no mistake, this is a STARK fight.  It’s a fight they’ve fought before.  The secret to fighting it again lies not in a fiery outsider.  The secret to this fight is written in the crypts, in the very bones of the Starks.

summary: someone: *writes long metas on why it’s ok for dany to have ambition and want power for herself* *writes long metas on why it’s...
body:
someone: *writes long metas on why it’s ok for dany to have ambition and want power for herself* *writes long metas on why it’s ok that dany is still learning* *writes long metas on why dany disagreeing with jon and tyrion isn’t a bad thing*

that same person: sansa is so power hungry and arrogant and rude. she’s too unqualified to be queen or lady of winterfell and she’s constantly undermining jon. i think in season 8 she’ll betray jon and dany

[ship and let ship]

summary: Also I’d really appreciate if people could separate J0nsas from Sansa stans. I’m a Sansa stan and I’d never, over my dead body,...
body:
Also I’d really appreciate if people could separate J0nsas from Sansa stans. I’m a Sansa stan and I’d never, over my dead body, ship J0nsa and I’m not writing dumb metas about Dark!Dany.

I know we’re maybe a small group of people but we exist and we have legit reason to adore Sansa Stark queen of all Gingers.

summary: Romance Over Rivalry: The Benefits of a Jon/Sansa Marriage
title: Romance Over Rivalry: The Benefits of a Jon/Sansa Marriage
excerpt: “When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.” —Eddard Stark, A Game of Thrones With Game of Thrones barre...
description: It’s often said that Game of Thrones isn’t about happy endings. But personally, I don’t see why not. The good guys and the innocents are constantly beaten down, so it would be satisfying to flip the script and end with their triumph. After all these characters have been through, there’s no sense in an end in which they all die or continue to suffer. While the endgame may not be neat and tidy, it likely won’t be all devastation, either. This series is about perseverance in the face of loss, and inner strength that overcomes adversity. For our heroes to come this far just to crash and burn would render the narrative almost pointless.
